intro: Descurainia sophia var. glabrata, commonly known as smooth sophia, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are usually glabrous or nearly hairless. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, and it produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
